column1: On [[9 December]] [[1965]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to Christine Jones''', a reader in New Jersey.<ref group=note>The name of the letter receiver is not given in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column3: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''. However, the letter is said to be kept at the Marquette University Library: in their records, the receiver is identified as "Christine Jones".</ref><ref name=CG>{{CG
column7: articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Collection: Other Tolkien Writings, 1911-1976

column1: *'''Subject:''' Reply to Jones' comments on the climax of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', which he found interesting. Apologies for his short letter.<ref name=CG/>
*'''Publication:''' A description of and quotation from the letter appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column2: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''.
If I answered all the letters I receive as they deserved, I should write nothing else.
